meanings.definition: A system of saving money for retirement.
meanings.sent1: My dad has a superannuation plan to save money for when he stops working.
meanings.sent2: It is important to start a superannuation fund early to have enough money for retirement.
meanings.sent3: The superannuation fund was so full, it looked like a treasure chest waiting to be opened.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her superannuation plan was like a steady stream flowing towards a secure future.
meanings.sent5: The concept of superannuation is like planting seeds of financial security that will bloom in retirement.

meanings.definition: The act of setting aside funds for retirement.
meanings.sent1: Regularly contributing to your superannuation is essential for a comfortable retirement.
meanings.sent2: She made the superannuation of a portion of her income a priority.
meanings.sent3: The superannuation of money for retirement felt like a secret stash waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent4: His diligence in superannuation was like building a strong foundation for his future.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the importance of superannuation is like unlocking the door to financial freedom in retirement.

meanings.sent1: Her superannuation grew steadily over the years, ensuring a comfortable retirement.
meanings.sent2: He checked his superannuation balance regularly to track his savings progress.
meanings.sent3: The superannuation she had saved up felt like a safety net for the future.
meanings.sent4: The superannuation he had accumulated was like a nest egg waiting to hatch.
meanings.sent5: The superannuation fund represented years of hard work and dedication towards a secure retirement.
